document.masterDocTitle: Two new species of Paravelia Breddin, 1898 (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Veliidae) from Colombia, with a key to Colombian Paravelia species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Two new species of Paravelia Breddin, 1898 (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Veliidae) from Colombia, with a key to Colombian Paravelia species

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type-material . Holotype , apt ♂: COLOMBIA , Departamento Nariño, Funes,
2 November 2009
, leg. D. N. Padilla (ICN). PARATYPES , same data as holotype , 1 apt ♂, 5 apt ♀, 1 macr ♀ (PSO-CZ); 1 apt ♂, 4 apt ♀ (ICN).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 11.
Paravelia acantha
apterous male, habitus without appendages in dorsal view. Scale 0.5 mm.

FIGURE 12.
Paravelia acantha
apterous male, abdomen (segments II–VII), lateral view. Scale 0.10 mm.

FIGURE 13 .
Paravelia acantha
apterous male, thorax, arrow shows fovea on mesoacetabulum, ventral view. Scale 0.05 mm.

FIGURE 14.
Paravelia acantha
apterous male, apex abdomen, ventral view. Scale 0.05 mm.

FIGURE 15.
Paravelia acantha
apterous male, genital segment. Scale 0.05 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Macropterous female ( Figs. 20 , 21 ). BL 3.32 , HL 0.54 , HW 0.78 ; ANT I–IV: 0.42 , 0.32 , 0.50 , 0.54 ; INT 0.40 , EYE 0.20 , PL 1.12 , PW 1.34 . FORELEG: FEM 0.80 , TIB 0.60 , TAR I–III: 0.02 , 0.08 0.16 ; MIDLEG: FEM 0.90 , TIB 0.80 , TAR I–III: 0.04 , 0.16 , 0.30 ; HINDLEG; FEM 1.26 , TIB 1.44 , TAR I–III: 0.04 , 0.20 , 0.28 .

Similar to apterous female in general structure and coloration with following exceptions: body brown, antennae and dorsal legs brown, ventral legs yellow. Head bearing a pair of shiny black, dorsal pits, near the corner of each eye ( Fig. 20 , 21 ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 16 .
Paravelia acantha
apterous male, fore leg: femur and tibia, lateral view. Scale 0.10 mm.

FIGURE 17.
Paravelia acantha
apterous male, hind leg. Scale 0.10 mm.

FIGURE 18.
Paravelia acantha
apterous female, habitus without appendages in dorsal view. Scale 0.5 mm.

FIGURE 19.
Paravelia acantha
apterous female, apex abdomen, ventral view. Scale 0.10 mm.

FIGURE 20.
Paravelia acantha
macropterous female, habitus without appendages in dorsal view. Scale 0.5 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Forewings pale brown with veins concolorours and some transparent areas mainly in the membrane (
Fig. 20
). Comparative notes .
Paravelia acantha
sp. n.
is similar in appearance and shape of the body, pronotum and mesoacetabulum to
P . capixaba Moreira, Nessimian & Rúdio, 2010
but differs in the others characters. Specimens of
P . acantha
can be diagnosed by the presence of spines on the fore and hind femora ( Figs. 16 , 17 ), and by having the parameres asymmetrical and semitriangular (
Fig. 15
).
